de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype
Class Generator

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.controller.datageneration.filltype.Generator
All Implemented Interfaces:
FillBehaviour, ObservableFillBehaviour, ObservableGenerator, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Address, Country, Dates, Email, FirstName, LastName, Name, Sex
public abstract class Generator
extends java.lang.Object
implements FillBehaviour, ObservableGenerator, java.lang.Cloneable

This class is an abstract generator class and implements FillBehaviour and ObservableGenerator interfaces. All generators must inherit form this class to get full functionality. A generator, in general, generates data to a specific kind of subject. So for example a generator for fist names does generate only data to satisfy that.

A generator is a special kind of fill behaviour and is substitutable with another behaviour. This is possible, since the fill behaviour is based on Strategy pattern.

Each generator inherited from this abstract class also is an observable. This makes it possible to list only those generators, to which observers have had registered to. For more informations about that functionality, have look at the observer contract.

Since:
Apr/30/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Constructor Detail

Generator

public Generator(java.lang.String name)
constructor assigns a name. The name should give information about what it does generate. It is also used to display in the UI.

The default language to use is set here to LanguageType.US. You should overwrite it with the provided method to fit your needs.

Notice, it's important to call the method setPathToFileByLanguage(). This has to be done manually, otherwise it would cause problems with the initializing of variables. Invoke the method in constructor of subclasses.

Parameters:
name - what does this generator generate?

Generator

protected Generator(Generator generator)
Clone
This constructor is only visible to same package. It is used to make a copy of this object.

Parameters:
generator - object to clone
Method Detail

getName

public final java.lang.String getName()
gets the name of this generator. The name should give information about what data it generates, actually. The name is used for displaying purposes.

Specified by:
getName in interface FillBehaviour
Returns:
the name of the generator

setPathToFile

public void setPathToFile(java.net.URI path)
sets the path to a flat text file. This file will be used to generate meaningful test data to an attribute (facet). We use this approach rather generating dull random test data. The advantage is, the tester gets real life data.

Notice, this method is the raw type to set a path. It doesn't take into account the language type. By contract, this has to be done by the invoker, to get meaningful data. If you aren't quite sure, we recommend you use setPathToFileByLanguage(LanguageType) method, instead.

Parameters:
path - path to file to use for data generation.

setPathToFileByLanguage

public void setPathToFileByLanguage(LanguageType language)
sets the path to a flat text file. The file is gonna be used to generate meaningful and realistic test data values for an attribute, also called a facet.

Maybe you've noticed there're two different methods to set the path to a file to use for data generation. This is because, this takes the language into account and the other doesn't quite do this. We recommend you use this method by specifying the language and the system take the appropriate steps.

Parameters:
language - rather specify the language and the system uses the right file itself.

setPathToFileByLanguage

protected void setPathToFileByLanguage()
this method does the job of choosing the right file depending on the language.

To get the right picture here an example:
Suppose you've used the default setting, that is US, then we get the following:

Resources/us/file.txt

If you do not want to use the default and you've chosen another language, say DE you get the following:

Resources/de/file.txt

Whereas file.txt depends on the concrete generator, that is the subclass of this abstract class. The file.txt can be substituted by any file the subclass uses.

This method makes therefore use of several different sub-methods to build up the whole path. First, the resource folder is created. This is fix and we know it.

Resources/

Second, the language folder is set. If the language isn't set explicit, we guess and take the default.

Resources/us/ (implicit by default)
Resources/de/ (if explicit set)

The last part, we don't know at this time and wait for a subclass to overwrite it. It's the actual file to use.

Resources/de/file.txt/

getPathToFile

public final java.net.URI getPathToFile()
returns the path to a plain text file to which the generator generates values. Because we do not generate dull random data, but real life valuable data. The file helps to achieve this, and the generator uses only values in that file which is linked here.

Here a word to the flat file:
The file is a plain text file, as mentioned above. Each line contains a single value and ends with a carriage return.

Returns:
the path to a file

setLanguage

public void setLanguage(LanguageType language)
sets the language specific type. This isn't always used by each generator. That depends on the context and on the attribute to fill with data.

When this feature is needed to generate proper values, and no other language is set the default will be used instead.

The default language is set to LanguageType.US.

Parameters:
language - language to use when attribute language specific values allows.

getLanguage

public final LanguageType getLanguage()
gets the language to generate data. This feature isn't always used and depends on the data generator. Some attributes allow to generate language dependent data. This is especially true for names, addresses, zip, email addresses etc. And with this parameter the corresponding values are used to fullfil that need. For example, when US has been chosen, then US data will be generated.

When no language has been set, the default language will be returned to the invoker.

The default setting is: LanguageType.US.

Returns:
type of language to generated data to.

calculateN

public int calculateN(java.net.URI file)
Description copied from interface: FillBehaviour
the job of this method is to calculate the total values, that is N = Σn_i. That is necessary to put each value a probability P(X=x) where x = n_i. That is for each value we give the probability.

To each filling behaviour we have to do this. For a deeper understanding here an example why this is necessary.

Example
Imagine having a value file called names.txt. The file has in total about 300 names, so as a result N = 300; Each of those values n = 1, ..., N gets a probability value later when it comes to probability distributions. A particular probability density function is laid over the values.

Probability density function
As an example we assume the Uniform probability distribution is used. The probability density function is for all values constant. In other words, each values is equal likely. P(X=x) = 1/N. 
 f(x)
  |
  |
  |------------ (1/N)
  |
  |
  |___________|______
              N    values

Specified by:
calculateN in interface FillBehaviour
Parameters:
file - the path to the file to calc the values
Returns:
N = Σn_i

getN

public final int getN()
Description copied from interface: FillBehaviour
each filling behaviour whether it is via a value file, an interval or by editor each of them has a range of values. This range is referred to as N. N is the total number of possible or available values to use for generation.

Example
Imagine having a value file called names.txt. The file has in total about 300 names, so as a result N = 300; Each of those values n = 1, ..., N gets a probability value later when it comes to probability distributions. A particular probability density function is laid over the values.

Probability density function
As an example we assume the Uniform probability distribution is used. The probability density function is for all values constant. In other words, each values is equal likely. P(X=x) = 1/N. 
 f(x)
  |
  |
  |------------ (1/N)
  |
  |
  |___________|______
              N    values

Specified by:
getN in interface FillBehaviour
Returns:
number of values N = Σn_i for this filling behaviour.

getValueAt

public abstract java.lang.String getValueAt(int n)
Description copied from interface: FillBehaviour
this method has the job of retrieving the value at the specified index. Most fill behaviour strategies are based on value files. These files have a specific amount of possible values from i = 1, ..., n where i is the index. When the process of generating test data is activated, to each facet values of the fill behaviour are used. To get values in the range of the value file, this method is needed. By the way, only the strategies itselves have access to value files.

Specified by:
getValueAt in interface FillBehaviour
Parameters:
n - the index specifies the value at position n to retrieve.
Returns:
the value at position n or null
